title: Is it positive to feel like the only person you can rely on is you and you don't need anyone to survive? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’d say it’s partly dependent on your personality. I feel energized by other people, even though i’m an introvert. It feels good to interact. Though I avoid interaction a lot based on bad experiences. So no matter how much i’m hurt i’m always gonna try again eventually because I get something out of having some sort of connection with someone. And I think that’s something we as humans need. We need close friends. We need to feel nurtured and cared for and heard. At all ages. People suffer illness from simply neglect. I’d say it’s extremely reasonable to end up in that position where you only rely on yourself. If most of what you’ve experienced with others is deep betrayals, then I’d say it’d be positive to only rely on yourself. I’ve felt completely betrayed by people i’d never expect to betray me. Members of the church, family members, thereapists, coworkers of two years or more, girlfriends, and lifelong friends. It’s hard to have trust after that. Not sure if it even is wise. And it’s frustrating because if i explain how i was betrayed, the person i’m talking to tries to get me to be empathetic to the other person. Even though they don’t even know that person. It’s like I can’t get any sympathy. So I mostly rely on myself. In some cases I keep certain connections in my life because the other person would try to trash my reputation if I were to leave. It’s pretty toxic. At the end of the day you’re the one who has to faces the consequences for all your decisions. It’s something i’ve been thinking about. If you rely on others for what decisions you make, you’re putting the fate of your future in their hands. And they might not even be thinking carefully about the direction they’ve pointed you. I try to be my own best friend. I try to think of the inner child within me who is so pure and deserves the best mentor and the most gentle treatment.

You don't NEED anyone else to survive. And it is incredibly positive to rely on yourself. If you were on an island alone and able to secure food and water, shelter — you wouldn't just die 😂 You would survive and rely on yourself daily. Anyone upset yet? 😏 A BIG however now. Would you thrive? Not really so much. You'd more simply just survive. It's important to understand clearly the distinction between survival and thriving. The people in our lives, the relationships we hold dear, the pains and gains we experience in our growth — that is a quality that enriches our survival, it brings life to life. Civilization would of never advanced if we hadn't collaborated and shared so much. It is our growth, both on micro and macro scales. It is also positive to understand indefinitely that you do not NEED these aspects to move forward. When you rely on you, you learn to not negotiate with negative people and experiences because if they aren't adding to your quality of life then they are deducting from it. If what you want is quality and they are not that, you don't need them. People stay in horrible situations for this reason; they feel they need and destroy theirselves in the process for that need. It only becomes self destructive if you utilize the perspective from an unhealthy state of mind, in which you put yourself on an island intentionally despite having the tools to build a bridge and a desire to cross back over it. The people in my life are a gift I cherish; they don't need me, not really. Their life would go on without me. But they choose to be a part of it despite it because I give them something beautiful, and they me. I had to earn that and continually earn that cause I work to keep it. Otherwise I'd just be on an empty island, surviving, not thriving.

Personally i think it’s up to you to decide what is positive and not positive. That said i think for me personally, feeling like I don’t need anyone to survive isn’t bad. Feeling like I need to hurt others, or get rid of others because I feel like I can survive alone-that’s where we get into different territory. Those are also often the people who say “oh I can survive on my own!i don’t need anyone!” with that braggadocio kind of attitude and use it to justify their hurtful actions to others. Otherwise, people who are connected to that primal self, the one that is alone, the part of them that's connected to the first man that ever roamed the earth. in relationships with others ?amazing (perhaps somewhat ironically). You have a beautiful thing if you do feel like you don’t need anyone to survive, and if you actually can survive without anyone. It means you never use people, you are there because you want to be. For me its made me rethink the purpose of relationships, and makes the relationships in my life like art. It’s a deeper sense of self few reach. That said its also okay to be vulnerable, people do need to feel needed and i think we all have some measure of need. And if you can fulfill that more vulnerable aspect, without giving away your primal self. i hope that makes sense.x

No. This breeds a posture of self-reliance, and self-salvation, and self-judgement, and ultimately self-worship. However, the Bible does instruct to trust no man, but the LORD. This command is simple but the lines and boundaries therein are subtle. We must honor the fallen nature of man; that is our neighbors and ourselves. As fallen we are broken, and as we wouldn’t rely on a broken clock for time, so too we shouldn’t rely on others nor ourselves to navigate through this world and this life. We must therefore look to the One who authored and continues to author all of existence. The One who drew the boundaries of time and space itself. For He alone knows where we must go and what we must do. I understand that not everyone believes in God or knows if He truly exist, but I must share that as a man who once tasted great worldly success by following my own will and trusting my own understanding; as a man who did not know or believe in God, I was a ruin. Only when I searched for Him did I find, and I have never known such fullness of joy. Here is a scripture which has helped me numerous times: Proverbs 3:5–8 5 Trust in the LORD with all your heart, And lean not on your own understanding; 6 In all your ways acknowledge Him,And He shall direct your paths. 7 Do not be wise in your own eyes; Fear the LORD and depart from evil. 8 It will be health to your flesh, And strength to your bones. I hope this helps brother.

Independence is a great thing but proving to ourselves that we can survive and suffer everything alone without any help isn’t that great. The world in humans are supposed to be connected the unfortunate thing is that there’s a lot of hurt hearts that come associated with human beings and relationships so for me anyway I’ve learned to trust myself and nobody else. i isolated and became prideful and resentment doing it all alone. you’re probably capable but I would ask yourself why you wanna manage it alone? is it fear of other people. for me it is, trusting others. and proving a point. But prove it for yourself, not at them. let other people help you and take their opinions and their advice into account but really ultimately the last decision is up to you/i. I always have a bunch of people weigh in on a decision because I like to take everybody’s suggestion but truly I make the decision ultimately on my own. I do like having those people that I love and trust giving me their opinion though because it does help me make my decision even though ultimately my choice is my own. instead of surviving try living. it includes others. ugh barf right? keep trying! your not alone! lol hugs!

Being able to survive on your own is a great thing! Many people strive to not need others, being self sufficient and independent is helpful in life because sometimes you may rely on people who will let you down. The only problem with this is that sometimes people who think they don’t need anyone can stop trying with other people all together, they cut them out of their lives completely because they think they don’t need them. This may work at first because you’re independent! You don’t need anyone! Until you come across something you can’t fix on your own and you have no one to fall back on. It’s not good to rely on other people all the time, but sometimes you will need help, and if you’ve already cut ties with people who you thought you didn’t need, you’ll have no one to turn to. You may be able to do things on your own, but humans are social creatures by nature and in order to live comfortable lives, we need other people. Being independent is great, but it’s also important to remember that needing help is not a negative, it’s completely normal and sometimes people forget that.

It is not about being positive or negative or a question of survival in such instances. Relying on oneself is good in many aspects, that is the sign of confidence and bravery, however, you need someone whom you can contact and rely on him, lean on him/ her. Many of the time we are getting pissed off if we entirely depend on someone we love and not getting what we wanted from them. Sure, but life is full of flaws and jackasses. You know yourself that you wouldn't/needn't depend on anyone, be it financially, or something other. But you can't survive anything with the absence of human around you. Life is not only about survival, it is all about everything, from earth to universe.

Disclaimer: opinions of a teenager. It depends. A lot. If you’re in a situation where that has to be the case, such as one being some sort of super duper secret operative who operates alone or the people in your life are 100%, irredeemably toxic, then I can see the merits. Of course, there are going to be situations where that isn’t the case at all, but the mindset above could still be helpful. But I don’t think most people live in a situation where that is necessary. True, it is helpful to be emotionally independent. But the mindset itself can lead to something worse. I’ll talk about my own experience. At my last school, I had some… unhelpful… friends. At a certain point, I really prized the exact sentiment you outline. But then, I moved out of that mindset. Yet, I was able to develop better friends and more emotional independence. See the thing is, that mindset will lead you to pushing away people that matter. And that will lower your own emotional stability and independence. Thus, I’d say that the mindset is unhelpful. In seeking emotional independence, I lost my way from it. And once I stopped using the mindset, I was able to move toward what I really wanted.

You know I might be cynical but that saying or close to it comes to mind, “you’re born alone and you die alone. Hopefully, that’s not the case but when circumstances are such that YOU are pretty much the one that is the most reliable and able, then it just becomes the norm. My parents couldn’t speak much English so no one was really there to help me w/ any school work and all the rest. I was very self sufficient. In fact, I could not wait to get out of the house - my thoughts were serious about that age 12. So, I function just fine and don’t really want to inconvenience anyone or have them go out of their way for me. It’s not that I have any self worth issues, I just like keeping it simple. Course, you have to pay for those services - dog sitting, cab/Uber rides - whatever but I just prefer to play it close to the vest in that sense. So bottom line to your question: No, it’s not a negative thing to be self reliant BUT it is important to have friends and be able to call on someone for support if need be. Nurture your relationships with friends and family. They are of value.

That's a self protective strategy. And it's 100% effective if you have enough resources to get you through to the end of your life. If you need more resources (like most people) then the reality is that you will have to rely on others. You'll have to rely on an employer or customer to pay you. You'll have to rely on your water company to give you access to water. You'll have to rely on the grocery store to sell you food. And then there's that little problem of social interaction. You see, humans are a social species. We can go a long time without human interaction, but it takes it's toll on us to be entirely solitary. Being self-reliant is a fabulous way to temporarily overcome trauma and beging the process of regrouping. But you'll eventually have to trust someone for something. See if you can trust people for the little things at first. Then go from there.

That is a message from your Ego. Egos are primitive and short-term-focused and often just plain wrong as far as long-term consequences go. Fools take the short-term action/focus as the Right thing to do; but is usually wrong in the end. Humans became a powerful species by learning how to cooperate in ever larger groups, then groups of Groups and finally huge Groups of Groups! Lately, however, we have allowed a number of Fear-driven humans to control society using competition; rather than cooperation. Such believe that they are not enough, just as they are, and have to get ever-more power and/or riches to be OK. That never works, but they are not smart enough to change their beliefs and be content with what they already have. By trying to tell yourself that you don’t need anyone else to survive, you go against your very nature as a human; the end result is to find you were wrong, and your life will likely be miserable for decades. However, you can foolishly choose a life of misery by failing to realize what it is to be human; but don’t blame others when you end up miserable for a lifetime! Your choice and your Karma! Ouch!

Yes. Being alone makes us strong. How to live, and especially thinking a way how to survive. You don’t really need anyone. You have yourself and you can fight your battles alone without someone because maybe that someone waits of a change in return. Put positivity in yourself. If you’re relying on someone, that someone might take advantage, he might judge you of what you’re doing secretly. Just smile. Positivity comes from yourself so you need to let it out especially if you’re just alone. I’ve been in your situation for almost half of my life and still counting. I’ve never been rely on someone. All you need to do is don’t care. Just think of yourself. Yeah, being selfish. Remember, you don’t rely. So, all you need to do is smile and learn to say “I can do this.” And so, I lived. Smiling but unhappy. By thinking positivity, I survived. 🌹

Image source: Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs From the perspective of emotional and psychological health, it’s considered not healthy. It may be possible for you to fulfil the basic needs but that’s all. We human are interdependent. Together, we are strong. We flourish by leaning on each other. We learn, we teach, we provide and we received from each other. That feeling may be your self-protection mechanism. That’s probably the world view you formed when you were younger (around 2 - 4) to keep you save. Maybe someone you trusted has let you down. Maybe you didn’t get the help you much needed or desired. That self-protection mechanism has prevented you from break down. Now that you have grown up, it’s fine to acknowledge that this is your current and past world view. It has served you well and you are ready to move on. You have grown wiser and will be able to tell whom to trust and rely on. Even if you get hurt, it’s fine. You can take it and learn from that. Go ahead, make friends and have fun!

Is it positive to feel like the only person you can rely on is you? Ultimately, that’s true, and it is positive to know that You can rely on You (assuming that’s true). However, it’s a lot easier to go through life knowing you have someone else, or many other persons, to help you make it through life. Is it positive to feel like you don't need anyone to survive? No, it’s not only NOT positive, it’s downright unrealistic. You need hundreds of people to survive. How do your groceries get to the store? How does electricity come into your home? How does potable water come out of your tap? How did your home get built? How do a million things in your life happen without other people? If you want to find out if you can survive without anyone else, go to the wilderness of Alaska and try living on your own. Most people can’t and die or give up and come back to civilization.

Well I certainly think that it is very sensible and therefore is likely to give rise to a positive sense of self reliance. This has been my approach to life since childhood in that I was fortunate to develop a sense of self reliance, largely because , as I found, in adulthood most people, even the closet will let you down, this is a generalisation of course and often it may be due to factors outside of their control but many will agree with me on this. Also, I should point out that an additonal benefit of developing a robust sense of self in life was/is the confidence to chart my own course, in matters both large and small, rather than following the crowd. In fact people frequently commented on my willingness to go it alone if necessary, even an absence of fear to do my own thing. As they say, we come in to the world alone and leave the world alone. Please note I am not in any way minimising the tremendous enjoyment of being with others.

It’s good to be independent but I wouldn’t recommend feeling like that, it be better to just start putting more effort or just effort all in all in to things you usually ask for help for or rely on someone else to do and just try doing it yourself and then if you need help asking for it but if you went around feeling like you could only rely on you and don’t need anyone to “survive” it’s like you could become a very stubborn person who thinks they can do a lot more then they can alone and/or thinks they do certain things the smartest way when they don’t and in time would make people reluctant to help you anytime in the soon future, would make you seem like a no it all, and would just make your life harder when it comes to completing certain task.

No for we humans are community peoples we need the support and help of others . Their friendship their guidance their backing at all times especially in times of trouble. We need to be able to turn to others for help, the high suicide rate the drinking the drug taking and the total loneliness around millions of people shows that we are loosing your community spirit and failing as human beens. To be only dependant on yourself is a sad reminded of how bad things are getting.

Personally I think so. As hard as it is. When we rely on other people we have certain expectations that might not always be met. And that can be disappointing and ruin relationships. but one think is to rely upon yourself and yet another to let other people to do nice things for you. after being through co trolling relationship I swore I’d never let anyone do it to me again. I thought that I had to be completely independent, self sufficient and not let anyone do anything for me without me ‘paying’ back. However just like I want to do nice things for people I love I have to let them do the same for me without feeling I owe them or they owe me something. It requires a patient person on the receiving end and a lot of awareness and trust which is possible to achieve.

Yes Steffan, it is positive, because that feeling is produced by your personality type - the real you. We all belong to different personality types, as determined by, for example, our date of birth. And some personality types would rely heavily on others to survive, while other personlity types, like you and myself, rely only on ourselves. And that is good and natural and normal. I am a Virgo, so by the way. But, we should have no illusions - life is sometimes so demading, that we just have to ask for- and greatfully accept, the help of others. That is why we should always treat other people with respect, even though we might feel we do not need them now or ever - because we never know when we might have to ask for help. In the meantime, you might find studying your own personality type a very interesting journey, on which you would get to meet the real wonderful you, and get to understand who and what you are, and why you are whom and what you are. Be your own best friend.

Does it feel positive and empowering or negative and disappointing? Most people learn and accept this to some degree in their 20s. You get to decide how that affects your life. It’s not necessarily a bad thing. Even surrounded by loved ones knowing you can depend on yourself can be a comfort. It means you know you’re making the best choices for yourself. That you have the confidence to handle most of what will come at you in life. If you’re bitter about it than you’ve probably experienced family trauma of some form. For something like that consider getting therapy. Unresolved trauma can really hold you back and if you truly want to depend on yourself therapy can help you resolve those issues and learn new coping skills. Best of luck.

It is a good thing that you trust your guts but survival needs other people. You cannot survive in the society without depending on others for a long time. Yeah you can live like a sociopath emotionless old dude but if you want to live a quality life then atleast have one person other than you family in your life who you can trust. Find a person like this. Deepen your friendship. People will give you examples how they made it alone through the life. As an expert in this field I would never recommend you to cut yourself from society and friends. I am talking about a best friend here not just fellow colleagues or like that. You can start with your neighbors. Please please don't listen to people who says you can. Yes you can but the price will be too much for you. There will lots of regrets when you will be on your train to….. Don't be one of those guys. Don't go through this alone.

Great question. For me, there are times when I think it's Positive to be able to rely on oneself to accomplish set goals and objectives but I also think it is also positive to “rely” (too strong of a word) I would use the word “trust” others with an open perspective that sometimes things may not go 100% my way. As your local positive realist haha, I would also Say there has to be a balance and I am sure you know this. When we were young we relied on ideally two people (mom and dad) to help us through the early stages of life, when we are sick, it would be our husband or wives, and when we are old potentially our kids to help us through the final cycle of life. Balance is key and I think it's Positive to do depend on yourself and others :) be well and be awesome my friend :)

This sort of feelings develop when a person expects a lot from others and in the end, gets nothing. After that, a person can think in this manner. This sort of feeling is positive for a time being but if it prevale so things can become complicated. Here are a few things that you can do to help yourself: 1:Don’t generalize one bad experience to everything in your life. Becuse its not possible that you always get decieved. 2:Its human nature that they like to interact with others to share their feeling and to get to know what is going on in others life. 3:Eventually we have to have a partner in life because we want someone whoo only cares for us, love us and understand us. 4:Just go with the flow and don't overthink about things that you can't control and change but what you can do is to stay happy.I am not talking about very big happiness rather observe a kid, sky, moon and stars this will help you to heal. Life is very short to just think about negative things.

Yes it's possible to feel that way , especially if you have been betrayed several times. However we all need people in our lives, we are a social Species. You need to find people in your life that you can trust. Create a network of people who are going to be likely to be of value to you in your life. To feel like you only need yourself is a defense mechanism. I hope you find someone in your life who is trustworthy to “need” in your life. Good luck ✌️

Self reliance is a worthwhile trait to nurture in oneself. The acceptance of one’s place in society is also worthwhile. We all need each other. Grocers and farmers and auto mechanics and salesmen and miners and chemical workers and medical workers and…it’s a vast interdependent network we belong in. It would be silly to imagine otherwise. Nevertheless, if it’s to get done, it’s up to you to get it done. No one wants to pay your rent for you, or to give you free food forever. It is expected that in some way you at least try to earn your way in the world. How you do that, and how well, is very largely up to you. You may discover you are not the only one you can rely on, but you have to be the one you rely on most. May you live long and prosper! 🖐 😊

It might seem that way but if we look deeply, we will discover that we are all interdependent on each other.. Who made your clothes? Who sowed the cotton in the fields, or made the chemicals and machines that make the fibres for them. Who provides the electricity for your home, to keep you warm? Who provided you with the computer that you sent this question from? Who designed the components, who sat at a computer working out where all the components will be situated on the printed circuit board? Who made your computers monitor, who delivered it to you? Where did the money come from to buy it? I guess it depends on your definition of survival though. Naked, alone,sat on a mountain top with no food or shelter, you won't last very long simply relying on yourself. Maybe perhaps, your expectations of others have been too high and you feel a bit thwarted by life.

No u dont need anyone but yourself having others is bonus if u lucky enough to have people. Sometimes we there for everyone support, kind word, loyalty, love things we dont do for ourselves but im very unpredictable person apparently i plan but sometimes react the apposite of my plan usually to get someone back or protect people i love ive recently decided to back off put my survival skills for me and my daughter omg my bestfriend flashlight me for bloke she knows wet day who has been violent and wrecked her beautiful home she said she backed away from me, bull ive slways been there for her protecting advice etc and she turned was like a stepford wife programmed to her scumbag boyfriend who tried to head butt on walk with our dogs at 6pm in d evening i head butted im sick ive iost a good friend but gained looking out for me hes hit her but she got to step up for herself like we doing for ourselves

Is it true that you are self sustained? if you look closer, you will see that your very existance is dependent on others. Your mother and father is part of you. Would you even be without them? The water and the air is part of you. Would you be without them? What you eat is possible because of the people working in farming, transportation, stores and so on. is your life independent of others? even survial in the wild: still you depend of others creating tools, clothes, knowledge etc. Your life is not your life. The ego is not the master of life. You are but a dust in this universe. Your life is worth the same as all other lives. We are thinking as separate and independent beings, but reality is something much more rich and beautiful. You are because I am. I am because you are.

I generally have learned to consult with myself. There is always someone telling you who you are, where you should be heading, how you can do better, what you'll be good at. I seek out consultation (advice) from credible sources. I need my friendships for support and such. But for huge decisions, what does my friendships advice mean to me? or strangers? Im here to customize my life and noticed as a kid that there are many ways to get to where one needs to go. I enjoy hearing others input but I ultimately decide don't i? I don't think its bad at all to be self reliant. it's good to also know we aren't alone and seeking help when needed is important too. Gotta keep the ego in check.

It's a necessity to be able to rely on yourself, because sooner or later, if you rely on somebody else, you're gonna get burned. It never seems to fail. & it doesn't matter how close you & the other person have always been…. When push comes to shove, I truly believe the biggest motto people live by these days is…..” Hooray for me & fuck you ! So yeah, most deffinatly learn to rely on yourself ! It's safer that way & if ya don't do so great at something, Atleast ya didn't hafta get your guts ripped out by someone you THOUGHT would always have your back, because it happens quite often. The only blame comes on my own shoulders if I'm the one who fucked something up AND I learned from it ( hopefully )

I think it is not only positive, but important….you need to be self-sufficient, if not life will become too hard to deal with….This will also keep you from being codependent from other people and you will not have expectations which will never be met by other people. It is part of being independent and making a good life for yourself! I am not saying that you should become so independent that you need to shy away from others….I think that it is a good way to be….I am fiercely independent and try not to rely on anyone one for anything…..moral support from other, reassurance, friendship from other people is also very important….you can’t live your life self-isolating from others….

Yes, its positive. If your the only one that gives yourself the motivation to stay strong keep going. But remember, we really can't do anything on our own, we can, but sometimes the situation can became burdensome. We all need is Jesus Christ in our lives each and everyday and every moment. He lifts the weight of Burden off of us. To help and get us through life. Stay strong be well. Remember to be full of Respect Compassion Kindness Humility and Love each and everyday.

Sounds like you’re lying to yourself, Steffan. No man is an island. Human beings are a social species. We are interdependent not only upon each other, but on the entire ecosphere. Every breath you take puts you in debt to the green plants that put the oxygen into the air. The microbes in your gut manufacture the enzymes that allow your nervous system to function. Had it not been for the care of your family, you never would have survived this long. If you pay attention, today you will notice how many other people are serving your needs. Expressing some gratitude will make you happier.

This is exactly what our inherently self-serving, self-justifying ego tries to tell us. And since at the same time we evolved into a globally integrated, fully independent world, where we are all but individual cells of a single Human “super-organism”, this misguided belief in our own omnipotence leads us towards self-destruction. We urgently need a unique, purposeful and highly practical educational method that can help us understand, moreover help us tangibly feel what our global interdependence actually means, and how we need to change, adjust ourselves to become compatible with it.

Absolutely. In all honesty it's the truth i learned that at 8 years old the only person you have is yourself. It's positive because you don't rely on people if everything falls apart. You can stand alone through the worst situations and look back and realize how much you've done all by yourself. We as people of course like to talk to other people it's natural but relying on yourself makes you independent. You benefit alot from relying on yourself help is nice and all but for me personally all you have is you.

I am positive I can rely on myself, just as I am positive I can rely on myself to ask for assistance if I truly need it. Having gone through survival training, I’m pretty confident I can survive, but it sure would be nice to have someone else with me in case of an emergency, the time when having help is really appreciated. There is nothing wrong with feeling positive about your ability to make it on your own. Always be ready to give 100% of yourself along your path, but watch out for potholes.

The answer is yes and no. It is good as it gives you a positive impression of yourself. It is better to be on your own than in a marriage where the two do not talk any more. But as a popular saying goes, ‘No man is an island.’ Humans need company, that is why even hardened criminals fear complete isolation. This is also one of the lessons COVID-19 has taught us. You will realise how much you need others in your old age and, I hope to god that this does not happen, if you were to become severely disabled.

It is a fact that you can rely on you. Who do you think that you can rely on? Your survival is your responsibility. However, to reach something, along the way, you need some help/assistance because there are some tasks which require two or more people. Not all people you come across, will assist you for free, often there’s some sort of exchange. Life is your experience, but in journey, you meet variety of people that you bond with. when you accept that your survival is your responsibility, you don’t become bitter when you have an expectation that someone supposed to be there and help you.

I would say it is not positive. However, it could be a way to protect the self, if you’ve been hurt. The fact is that humans are social. We need social interactions. We desire social interactions. If you find you get nothing from these social interactions I would suggest speaking with a therapist. We rely on others indirectly everyday. You turn on the light and expect it to work. You don’t think of everyone that has worked to make sure your electricity is functioning.

yes it's called being an adult and is a good space to be in as you are differentiated As long as you are able to still ask for help if you need it and can allow people to get close to you sometimes when we get use to not having our emotional needs met we can become to independent and think we don't need any body but we all need someone sometimes as long as we don't become to co dependant on them

It is neither positive nor negative. It is good to be an independent person. Please don’t forget that we all are social creatures. We get happiness/help from the one we love/get along. Yes we get hurt sometimes when we don’t get what we expect from them. Being too much dependence on others is really toxic on them and to ourselves. At the same time, doing everything by ourselves is very tiring as well because we don’t have capability to do anything and it is good to seek for help. In this case, I would say “Have balance on both independence and dependence”.

In my view, it's a hugely positive attitude to be self-reliant and independent.One's creative energy and power rise to the surface when you look within yourself for guidance and direction. But this must be rightly understood.It does not mean you cannot trust anyone,nor does it mean you have to be an island onto yourself.We are all all one,inseperabe from one another,bound by the living energy of Source. In practical terms,we need one another to co-create the experience and environment we desire.We do this with a clear understanding of the inviolability of our individuality,our spiritual space and personal responsibility for our lives. I hope my answer helps.

Thanks Steffan for A2A. Basically it is a pyramid under your feet; you need a few close ones, either family members & relatives or friends & acquaintances positioned with relative grading before reaching the ground level, meshing with base of pyramid. Why? Because there are situations where you are possibly alone and cannot do anything. It can be an accident (God forbid). It can be a serious health issue appearing suddenly. It may be fire engulfing house (forget fire department as they do their job). A sudden shock of circumstances can also result in cry for immediate help from someone. So on and so forth. You stay at the top of the pyramid any way. Thanks for reading my viewing this question.

Tough question. I mean, I've only had myself to count on pretty much since I was 3 years old. Which is why I believe in God. Someone had to have been looking out for me. So yes, you can live your life & not count on anyone else. But, there are people in place that can help you. It's like why I believe. He will place a complete stranger in your path who will do or say something that you've been looking for an answer for. He will put specially trained folks around to give you a lift up. And sometimes He will put people in your life to cheer you on. So you need those people. Always be open to helpers who guide & don't ask for anything. Be a helper yourself if you can. But you don't need people in your life that are anchors & will abandon you at the bottom of the ocean once you stop going places. Respect yourself & make others do the same. Just try to be open for true love & friendship.

Is very positive. I mean, there are good people too, but the only one responsible for your life is yourself. If you expect other people to be responsible for things that you’re committed to, such as your own well being, progress and safety; then you are giving your freedom away. My recommendation is to be open to enjoy the freedom. In my experience, you shouldn’t depend on no one nor nothing else but you. Be free, be open to evolve your mind, that I think is even a sign of a healthy self esteem

That's not necassarily true. Some people are fully self sufficient, and self reliant. Is say that's actually a natural form of confidence in ones self, even if you know that you don't always make the “right" decisions. Really on a psychological level or just means you're confident in your ability to do and achieve things. There's nothing wrong with that, and if say it's actually a gift most would wish and strive for. Personality might have a lot to do with it as well, it's not exactly something that is quantifiable

See this “BE GOOD TO YOURSELF,ENJOY YOURSELF AND YOUR OWN COMPANY,DO FOR YOURSELF WHAT OTHERS CANT DO FOR YOU AND FINALLY, APPRECIATE YOURSELF, BECAUSE WHEN EVERY OTHER PERSON LEAVES,YOU ARE LEFT WITH YOU AND YOU ALONE”. Now,that's for you to know that you need YOURSELF more than you need others. Although no MAN(humanity) is or can be an island. You still need a few people (others) to be there for you. But then you have to also believe in yourself. That will save you from disappointments.

Is positive and negative at the same time. Positive because you know you don’t need anyone to make you happy. You have good confidence in yourself which is great. However.. if you feel like you’re the only person you can trust, it could be lonely. Not letting anyone in and not trusting anyone. No one to fall back on when you really need someone. At least have one person in your life who can help if and when you need it :)

Being self-reliant is good to a point. After that point, it’s not extremely positive. I speak from experience. While it has many virtues, it can also rob us of true intimacy and the type of friendships and relationships we need. Many people are self-reliant to a fault, putting far too much pressure on themselves. They bring self-reliance to a new level because they are unable to rely on anyone. Being able to rely on others for some things takes a lot of pressure and stress from us. Reliance on friends, mates and family can be very healthy and affirming. Sure, we may be able to survive on a desert island but does it make our lives better? It’s human nature to be one part of a close, trusting, intimate, loving, forever couple because life is really too hard to do alone and it gives us things we simply cannot provide ourselves like encouragement, another’s respect and someone who looks up to us, someone who needs us, someone to lift us up when life knocks us down. We can give ourselves a lot of things but some things only really help if it’s coming from another person.

No, l don't view it as possitive but very sad. Sometimes you do need to reach out and ask for help. Have you been burnt by people whom you thought would help but let you down? There is more going on here than just asking for help. I think your hurt about something in particular and that l can't help you with as you don't mention it or give examples. You have my word that if you want to let me know, l won't bail on you. God bless.xo

No, I wouldn’t say that feeling like you’re the only person you can rely on and that you don’t need anyone to survive is a positive thing—I think that you’re misguided if you feel this way. Don’t you need doctors, dentists, and grocers—just to name a few? We’re all going to eventually need a doctor. In fact, it’s often the people who say that they can get along fine without any doctors who die young.

While it’s definitely healthy to depend on yourself, it’s silly to think we don’t need anyone else. Think of the breakfast you have every day. It takes hundreds of people to get those products to your home. We all depend on each other to some degree, and we also depend on ourselves. It’s not one or the other, it’s both. Hope this helps!

I can see a couple problems with this view towards life. While sometimes it can seem like people can hold you back and keep you from what you want in life. But the right people can encourage you and help you towards your goals. You shouldn’t see this as a positive solution to keep moving forward. So I’d say no, it is not a positive way to feel. And while it can seem positive because you are so done with people, it isn’t. Sorry if this is confusing, but I hope it helps!

Heart of gold, balls of steel is good. Take care of u, rely on only u, but what if u do need support? Is that such a bad thing? Is it because u dont want to feel vulnerable. Did ur Dad tell u that? I'm not saying its negative to think that way but I also dont see that as the most positive for anyone. Everyone needs someone. Look right now, asking for advice. Be tenacious, fight ur hardest to get and to be what u want to be or do with ur life, but everyone needs some type of support.

Hello Steffan Thank you for your request to respond to the question however I'm not a health professional. So many answers for you! In my opinion, the answer is a cautious yes. Survival instinct is great. The caution is around how the person interacts with others or if they isolate from society. The positive is that it is great to be self reliant. The downside is if this stems from a place of injury, mistrust, fear of others, etc. Blessings

ITs positive to feel that way about yourself but not feel that way at the exclusion of anyone else. Even if you don’t currently have anyone else, you should still remain hopeful in the human condition. Enough to believe there is someone else out there that could have your back as well. Why? Because we’re a social species and that’s what we do when we’re healthy. We believe in each other and our selves.

If you think the opposite of your question one might be waiting for ever for a hand up. First we must know that no matter whatever happens throughout life and in death, we will all be just fine. Just be a free spirit and remember the less fortunate than yourself. In other words live life and enjoy, but don’t keep your head above the clouds, so not to see those around you needing a helping hand. The most blessed thing all of us can do, is to give of our self to the less fortunate among us.

No, we live in the human world and need others in order to sustain a good life with cooperate with others and give and take with our gifts from God to succeed in life. It means every one of us received special gifts from God which no other person possesses what you received thus God wants you to use your gifts to the fullest and others’ gifts will benefit you and me. None of the humans can survive alone. It may seem like can but it won’t last long.

It isn’t positive. Actually it is false since every person has to rely on someone else simply because no one is capable of being self-sufficient. To grow as a human being and develop self-knowledge it is necessary to have relationships with others. Also no one is satisfied just surviving, everyone wants to thrive. We are social creatures and so we need one another in order to function fully.

When you rely only on you you become a fool because, how do you know that you do the right thing? Using what reference? Put God first and get to know him to see that he does indeed love you and he wants you to live for him only. That's why he sent Jesus to die on the cross for you and tour sins. More and more people nowadays get their eyes opened to Gods love and this is a good thing.

Relying on yourself to get things done in your own life is smart and arguably positive because it puts all the responsibility on you and not on other people. Thinking that you don’t need anyone is unscientific, unrealistic and a possible defense mechanism to avoid getting hurt. Striking the balance between self-reliance and community is the healthiest approach and will get you further faster.

Yes. I feel the only person I can truly rely on is myself. I value being self-sufficient and independent. I don’t like having to depend on others. Something like needing a ride home from the doctor’s after a procedure is one thing, but being financially dependent on someone else is quite another. Being dependent on myself, I know I can count on myself and don’t have to worry about being disappoointed or let down.

It’s certainly a good illusion. In fact we all need a lot of people (mostly anonymous to us) just to be alive. However, feeling sad by being alone even when our basic needs are met can sometimes lead us to disastrous (or just unnecessary) relationships. I understand the evolutionary pressure in our species to bound (after all we are social animals) but in our technological and pandemic time, being comfortable by being alone while making our part to help out the planet and others, whenever possible, can certainly help (who knows this can even become the next evolutionary trait humankind will have to develop; being a “loyal loner”).

Depends completely on your perspective.. People value other people with those kind of qualities and use it as a source of motivation. Which I would absolutely consider positive. On the other hand, experiencing that kind of loneliness and rejection first hand is real suffering. But if your able to make it out alive, you would have the feelings of fulfillment and accomplishment

Yes, it is VERY POSITIVE for ME to be the only person that I MYSELF depend on. I don’t need anyone else to survive. Let me REPHRASE that: I rely first and foremost in God’s Son Jesus SPIRITUALLY, but as far as HUMANITY goes, I need no one other than myself while on earth. After THAT, I’ll let “Jesus take the wheel.”

You need to rephrase. “the only person you can rely on is you” yes, that is true, most others will often fail to be there when you really need it. You need good friends to weather the storm well, but sure if you have the skills then you can do it alone, but it’s easier with good friends to help you out when you are neck deep.

Yes it is a positive thing to think so. Because no matter how much good some is to and how much ever he helps you the reality is that he wouldn't leave with you forever. So instead of depending upon others it is better to make yourself a person capable of survival in every situation with out needing others.

Its positive to stand on your own and be responsible for yourself. We all need loving people in our lives though. If you haven't had that, it doesn't mean you won't. Don't isolate yourself too much. You may miss meeting that one person who speaks to your soul. Its positive but don't become so self sustaining that you miss out on love.

It’s possible to survive completely on your own, but it’s hard to thrive that way. (And there’s a big difference between surviving and thriving.)It’s good to know you trust yourself and are self-sufficient. However, you’ll probably go farther in life when you include other people.

Hi, I can relate to you, for me that was a very difficult in my life where I experienced a lot of rejection and I literally felt alone and somehow it feel like people were not playing an important role in my life. I personally think this could be a reflection or result of what you are going through or have went through in the past. Have you tried getting to the root of this feeling? Have you thought about why you feel like this? There could be things to be dealt with and wounds to be healed in your life. People play an important role in our lives, I personally believe that God has created us to have a need of to relating with others… However I sympathize with you if this is the result of certain wounds in your life? If this is the case and you feel like you can talk to someone, these lines are open to reach you where are right now, if you are willing you can call How to Find Help in Times of Crisis | Listly List and find help.

In the modern world you do not directly need anybody in order to survive. That being said, we are a tribal species. More so, there are a lot of wonderful people out there. Give them a chance to be in your life and give yourself a chance to have a collection of great people around you.Have fun!

There’s a word called “interdependence” which means a combination of being self reliant but also knowing one is not an island. Different strokes for different folks. What’s right for one is not right for another. There are people who marry early and stay married all their lives. Some people stay single all their lives. No one right answer.

I do not believe that it is negative, but it lacks a completeness and a general trust in humanity, while there is nothing wrong with being independent, being a very reliable person is something that would benefit others and should not be hoarded for yourself, in the process of sharing your reliability you may learn that others can be reliable also and that connection is priceless.

Dear..i think its good to spend time alone but as u are saying its not good ..because somewhere we need someone in our life to share our emotions..if we will stay alone then somewhere we will not able to enjoy our life …dear interaction with other people is good …i know when we have bad experience of interacting others then we live alone …but i think somewhere in life we need people ..i hope u will get my point ..stay happy

No person is an island we are all part of the collective universe (consciousness) In thinking you are the only person you can rely on, you are shutting off your connection to the universe to bring miracles into your life. This entails bringing necessary persons to assist you in moving your life forwards in the direction you wish to take.

Yes its good to rely on yourself! Getting others input on descions and such is extremely helpful but not fully taking everyones word for what they say can save you from lots of embarrassments, mistakes, and what not Unless youre in a relationship. The goal should be to feel like you can rely on people in a relationship lol

In a way yes, but you must understand that there are things that you can not do by yourself and it’s okay to ask for help, but it’s also okay to feel uneasy about trusting others. It’s great to be independent, just don’t forget there are times to be independent and times to let others help/support you.

yes! and for good reason, but to an extent. as much as we need people in our lives for mental sanity and enjoyment. we cant expect anyone to not drop the ball when we depend on them from time to time so have more than one backup plan and diversify your options don't just pick one and tink your good.

Sometimes u haven't got a choice. When people have stopped believing in u then u have to believe in yourself. I dont think its healthy to have to rely completely on yourself. It's nice when u have others to rely on, sometimes that's not always possible though. So u have to become self reliant and dont let others take ur dreams away.

Idk if it's a Positive thing. But seriously, we need each other. We need to communicate with each other to get current information that will help us to make better choices and lead us to better places. You can help yourself by listening to trustworthy ppl. Ppl who act the same positive way everyday.

In many ways yes. It means you are taking responsibility for yourself as you have realised nobody can do that except you. While there are many positives to being self reliant the drawback is you are less inclined to reach out and ask help from others because you believe they will let you down. This will hold you back at times because there are times when we need the help from others even to survive.

Empowered, I know my own strength; My limits exist only where I let them. I can run and run without stopping, I can fall and take hits without breaking. Indeed, I know I can take care of myself. I delight in my ability to live alone, Yet, I yearn to lean on someone’s shoulder. I may be strong, but I hate being lonely.

In some way we have to rely on our self first. Still with out an object partner to love life will be impossible to achieve true love. To achieve true love sacrifice is necessary like mother giving birth to a baby. No pain no gain. May be able to physically survive alone but absolutely need an object partner to be happy in life.

I’d say you’d be abnormal if you had to rely on others for your own well being, instead of having the adult independence to be able to create your own path. That doesn’t mean you can’t develop strong relationships with others, but I would NEVER rely on another person for my own well being.

No . Think about ALL the people that are needed to make your life work. Do you grow your own food? Make your own clothes? Do surgery on yourself? Get my drift? It’s another thing not to trust anyone. It’s a good thing if you can find a couple of trustworthy people.

Absolutely! Incredibly positive. The truth is no matter if we are single or coupled we really take our life journey alone. Finding your inner power and enjoying your own company is powerful! Congratulations! Way to go.

I used to think that I (and I alone) could take on the world. Then I discovered that line of thinking was responsible for people running away from me. My friends were distancing themselves from me and my arrogance. Social survival requires friendships. Bonds. Alliances. Trust.

It’s not okay, it’s good to be able to care for yourself with or without someone but you should remind yourself that it’s okay to get support from others every once and while too. That’s why friends, mothers, fathers, siblings, etc exist because they’re there to be there for you and you to them.

No, it’s a delusional thinking. We are NOT independent. We are interdependent. We DO need another people to survive. That way of thinking is oftentimes a defense mechanism. Ask yourself, if you were raised in a loving family, in which your parents are /were trustworthy.

Positive or negative would be a matter of an individuals perspective. From my perspective, saying and believing I dont need anyone is a challenge for more things to endure on my own. Its good to learn and know as much as you can on your own, and be self reliant, but its also wise to know when to ask for help or accept it.

It's good to be as self sufficient as possible: People will always let you down. But you can't do everything, so at some point you will need to ask for. Make sure it's someone you trust, and only ask for help if you've exhausted all other options.

It's positive but also realistic, because it's the truth. Many people don't realise that though because they think they need Or have been told that they won't survive without another person. People have been substituting human contact for years with things like pets, music , art etc.
2 seperate issues.Correct you can only rely on yourself even if that means trusting others. you need people to survive. asking your question youre around the wrong people.

Positive or negative are extremely subjective and essentially tied to outside influences, war or peace, scarcity of food or abundance, etc. There is an infinite spectrum between positive and negative. Most of life is soundly in the middle. The extremes are highly atypical and defy human social instinct.

It’s a very lonely, isolated place to be- we all need other people, it helps us to understand ourselves (by the reactions we get from others- it teaches us who we really are. Without that interaction, we can become delusional, and introverted 🤯) x

Yes; while being human we have choice to live on our own or in groups, a common myth is we absolutely need others in our lives - but this is just a myth as told by those who feel great need for others. However one can live alone and do Very well.

Co-dependence - supporting each other’s lower selves and enabling bad behaviors - is bad Interdependence - supporting each other’s higher selves and encouraging good behaviors - is good. No person is an island unto themselves.

I have learned that the only person I can fully count on is me. I’ll always fight like hell for me to win. Others could care less unless they have something to gain. So yeah, it’s positive to feel the only person you can count on is you.

Self-confidence mixed with reality is great. But part of the reality is how much you do need others- for food, gasoline, electricity- whether you like it or not unless you are a super survivalist who can live in mountains hunting meat and eating mushrooms.

i think it is good to think that you are the best person for you to rely on because we are often disappointed when we try to rely on others. However, no man is an island, meaning we humans require connections and therefore, need others to survive.

It is true but still negative and still sick. To make it positive you have to continue beyond yourself as in “the only person you can rely on is you and don’t need anyone to survive but others need you and you have to grow to be a support for others.”

I do not know what you mean by “positive”; I KNOW I do not need to count on other people if I do not count on myself. So, yes, It gives me power to be responsible, and if people are there is fine, and if they are not there is also fine.

No. You are denying the obvious reality that we are dependent upon others for survival. By doing that, you are depriving yourself of necessary physical and social support. As john Donne said “no man is an island.”

I dont see why being 100% confident within yourself is negative. Not to mention that's not saying should you choose to share your life with someone else that you wont be able to have a relationship. Life isn't about survival its about living. So now that you know you can survive…..LIVE LIFE TO THE FULLEST.
I don't know if it's positive or not to feel that way. As a human I crave contact with people even if its just going somewhere. I don't know have you believe but you can talk to God, he helps me.

That is positive, that gives you responsibility. You are responsible for yourself and you need to take control over your life. You are the king of your kingdom and you need to treat yourself with respect. If you want to learn more about this topic contact me.

We need others in our lives. We do. It is also very wonderful when we feel empowered to face life with great self confidence/resilience. The fact is we need both: confidence in our own selves AND connection to the rest of the human race!! ingrace, Ilene

Well, the old adage;- ‘’no man is an Island’’ pretty well answers that question. However, that adage should be tempered the with another maxim;- ‘’love many, trust few and always paddle your own canoe’’.

Yes and no you do need others to help because you will go more towards insane but you can go alone walf and it is possible to survive on your own but I'd rather you see some help because it will bring your feelings down over time

Del Bert has a fantastic answer here for you. If you need no other human being to survive first off you’re on the wrong planet. Secondly if you need no other person to survive you already are from another planet

We need to make a positive physical presence with positive communication skills. The perceptions of need, want or desire are different. Emotions are elective for some people. We design our own world more today than ever.

Very dangerous thinking. No person is an island and we all have blindspots. But easy to think highly of yourself when everything is going well. But when “it” hits the fan…. Better to be the Ant….not the Grasshopper.

No. It's good to try and be self reliant, and confidence is important, but cultivating the feeling that you can't trust anyone but yourself will lead to isolation. You'll survive, but you won't enjoy it.
Yes being financially independent of anyone's attitudes is best feeling. An you still encounter those who will get jealos an treat you like they are doing you a favor.
Nope …. in personal matters I am the one to go to first however there are so many other experiences that we depend on to exist. We are all corrected and that is how we stay connected.
Hello. This helps a person develop resiliency and resiliency is positive as it will help you get through a log in life on your own and will definitely help you survive. Thanks for A2A
In my opinion it is not positive. Have you seen the movie Into the Wild or Tracks? No one can survive on their own. Physically nor mentally.
It's a good feeling to have BUT what happens - when that feeling goes!? A much better ’feeling’; IF NEED be, there's someone in your life you can rely on..
The only person that you can really rely on is yourself is generally right & positive. However the rest of your statement is absolutely wrong.

This is ultimately true. All Truth and Happiness in life can only be found inside, in your Self. Meditate morning and evening to find Pure Consciousness, whose nature is Bliss and Peace. Daily meditation leads to Enlightenment, the goal of life.

Theres is some good aspects to this but also not always. It is 1000% always the best thing to be independent on yourself but ive learned and seen that it can also pull you away from people to have that perspective.
The first part is true. The second part is not for you need people to survive in this interdependent world.
UnfortI have no choice. I AM ALONE. THERE IS AND NEVER WAS NO ONE..NOW IS ACCEPTING THAT WHICH BACKS ME IN A CORNER OVER HALF THE TIME. ITS PART OF REASON I GIVE UP
I wouldn't say it's positive or negative. I'd say if you're capable of surviving alone that's good. If you can help someone else. That's great too.
Self-reliance is the only way to lead a self-determined life — you choosing your own path. It’s positive — if it’s balanced out with the capacity for love.
I really dont know the answer because I'm not sure if I'm a negative person I've been told this that I am but I would say there is nothing wrong with dealing on yourself
no because we all can use a little help along the way but sometimes life makes you feel as tho you are the only one you can trust.
If that’s how you are, why the need to grade it positive or negative?
Steffen, you may believe what you are saying, however, humans are social animals and if deprived of human contact do not survive for long. Mick
The part with “rely" is true, but you still need others to survive even if there is luck and disappointment in the game.
That is wonderful to be self reliant. But, we humans also tend to be social. Do what is best for your individual needs.
Nope. We all need other people in our lives. We are independent individuals living in an interdependent reality.
